meanings.definition: A shot taken at an easy or vulnerable target.
meanings.sent1: The hunter took a potshot at the rabbit.
meanings.sent2: He always takes potshots at his little brother during playtime.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's potshot at the president got a big laugh from the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her constant potshots at my work ethic are starting to get on my nerves.
meanings.sent5: Taking a potshot at the bullseye, the archer hit the mark perfectly.

meanings.definition: A casual or aimless criticism or attack.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't resist taking a potshot at her rival's outfit.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech was full of potshots at his opponents.
meanings.sent3: His potshot at my cooking skills was actually quite funny.
meanings.sent4: The journalist's article took a potshot at the city's lack of progress.
meanings.sent5: Her constant potshots at my taste in music are getting old.
